item.title: Lola na isang dekadang bulag, bigla na lang nakakitang muli
item.description: Mahigit 10 taon nang bulag ang 94-anyos na si lola Teting dahil sa katarata. Pero kahit nawalan siya ng paningin, hindi raw tumigil sa pagdarasal ang matanda. At isang araw, nagising na lang siya na muling nakikita ang paligid kahit hindi naman siya inoperahan. Isa nga bang himala ang nangyari? Alamin.

item.title: Metro Manila s biggest COVID-19 quarantine facility set to open in Parañaque
item.description: The biggest quarantine facility for cases of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in Metro Manila is set to open on August 25 in Parañaque City, the deputy chief implementer of the government s pandemic response said Monday.

item.title: Navy presence to ensure Fuga Island won't be controlled by China, says chief
item.description: "The President is very specific that the Navy will be given a 20 hectare area in Fuga Island for the development of a navy detachment, part of that navy detachment will be a future littoral monitoring station, fenced area, and elements of a naval detachment," Philippine Navy chief Vice Admiral Giovanni Carlo Bacordo said."Our presence there is assurance enough that Fuga Island will not be under the control of the Chinese," he added.

item.title: House OKs medical scholarship, return service bill on 3rd reading
item.description: The House of Representatives on Monday approved on third and final reading the measure seeking to establish a scholarship and return service program for students who intend to pursue a degree in medicine.

item.title: Viral QC ostriches not covered by permits, says DENR
item.description: Cruz decided to temporarily keep the ostriches in the Quezon City village as he waited for the seller to give him other necessary documents as regards their possesion, Antiporda said.

item.title: As Trump falters, Democrats and Biden eye an elusive prize: Texas
item.description: As polls show Texans increasingly frustrated with President Donald Trump's response amid a massive resurgence in coronavirus cases, Democrats say they have a real chance to turn a long-held dream into reality: winning the state's presidential contest for the first time in more than four decades.

item.title: Robredo: Rise in COVID-19 cases due to increased community transmission, not expanded testing
item.description: “Look at our positivity rate. Global standard is less than 5%. Let us not content ourselves with just reaching our targeted testing capacity. We should work at lowering our positivity rate to less than 5%,” Vce President Leni Robredo said.“Our big numbers are not just a function of increased testing but the fact that community transmission is really bad now,” Robredo added.

item.title: Indonesia s Mt. Sinabung blasts tower of smoke and ash into sky
item.description: Indonesia's Mount Sinabung erupted Monday, belching a massive column of ash and smoke 5,000 meters (16,400 feet) into the air and plunging local communities into darkness with a thick layer of debris.

item.title: Bong Revilla on isolation due to COVID-19: Ang hirap pala nito
item.description: "Giniginaw ako. Nagchi-chills ho ako. Ang hirap pala nito. Walang makatulong sa iyo, mag-isa ka," Senator Ramon Bong Revilla Jr. said in a Facebook live video. "Ang hirap ng ganito hindi mo pwedeng asa-asahan ang pamilya mo, kahit mga tao mo. Ikaw lang ang puwede maka... You have to be responsible 'pag nagkaroon ka ng ganitong sakit," he said.

item.title: Duterte order to not join naval exercises in South China Sea within rule of law --Bacordo
item.description: Philippine Navy chief Vice Admiral Giovanni Carlo Bacordo on Monday underscored that President Rodrigo Duterte's order prohibiting Philippine troops from joining other countries in conducting naval exercises in the South China Sea is within the rule of law.

item.title: Companions of elderly, immunocompromised persons urged to wear face mask at home
item.description: People living with elderly and immunocompromised individuals are encouraged to wear face mask even if they are inside the home, the Department of Health (DOH) said Monday.

item.title: House gives final OK to proposed Bayanihan 2 Law
item.description: The House of Representatives on Monday approved on third and final reading the proposed Bayanihan to Recover As One Act or Bayanihan 2 outlining P162 billion-worth of response interventions to help the country recover from the COVID-19 crisis and boost the economy.

item.title: Alamin kung saan sa Pilipinas makikita ang kahali-halinang tanawin na ito
item.description: Sa mga naglilista ng mga lugar na plano nilang puntahan kapag natapos na ang problema sa pandemiyang dulot ng COVID-19, bakit hindi isama ang kahali-halinang tanawin na ito sa Pilipinas.

item.title: China sends fighter jets as US health chief visits Taiwan
item.description: Chinese air force jets briefly crossed the mid-line of the Taiwan Strait on Monday and were tracked by Taiwanese missiles, Taiwan's government said, as US health chief Alex Azar visited the island to offer President Donald Trump's support.

item.title: Cayetano: Bayanihan 2 funds to be used for public service, not 2022 campaign kitty
item.description: Speaker Alan Peter Cayetano on Monday assured Bayan Muna party-list Representative Carlos Zarate that the funds to be allotted under the proposed Bayanihan to Recover As One Act will be used for public service.
